definitions.body: bridle (Aram. (Targum) [[מִתְגׇּא]]; NH [[מֶתֶג]] of secondary accent [[]]—[[ֽ]]; [[מִתֵּג]] Pi. denom. put on a bridle);—

lit. bridle, for animals; [[מֶתֶג]] [[לַחֲמוֹר]] Pr 26:3 a whip for the horse, a bridle for the ass, etc.; [[וׇרֶסֶן]] ´[[בְּמ]] Ps 32:9 with bridle and halter (on text of verse cf. Che); of ´[[י]]'s birdle for Sennach. (under fig. of beast), [[וּמִתְגִּי בִּשְׂפָתֶיְ]] 2Ki 19:28 and I will put ([[וְשַׂמְתִּי]]) my hook in thy nose and my bridle in thy lips = Is 37:29 (v. Dr:Is. ed. 2, 220).
fig. = control, authority, only in [[הָאַמָּה]] ´[[מ]] 2Sa 8:1authority of the mother city, acc. to MV Buhl, of. Esp. We Dr; Bu om. as corrupt (v. 1. [[אַמָּה]], p. 52 supr.); vid., further, HPS.
